RTCIceCandidateProtocol.summary:
The interface's read-only protocol property is a string
which indicates whether the candidate uses UDP or TCP as its transport protocol.

remarks.para:
The protocol field's value is set from the candidateInfo options object passed to the constructor.
You can't specify the value of protocol directly in the options object, but its value is automatically extracted from the object's candidate a-line, if it's formatted properly.
protocol is null by default if not specified properly in the SDP, but this is an error condition and will result in a thrown exception when you call .

RTCIceCandidateProtocol.value:
A string that indicates what network protocol the candidate uses:
NOTENote: If protocol is null — and protocol is supported by the user agent — passing the
candidate to will fail, throwing an OperationError exception.
